alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Northern Erie; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued January 11 at 3:43AM EST until January 14 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible. * WHERE...Erie and Chautauqua counties. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...The rapid rise in water levels at the eastern end of Lake Erie may result in lakeshore flooding along the Lake Erie shore. Flooding is possible along Route 5 in Hamburg, Buffalo Harbor and Canalside, Dunkirk Harbor, and other flood prone locations. Very high wave action may also result in significant shoreline erosion.
info.instruction: A Lakeshore Flood Watch means that conditions favorable for lakeshore flooding are expected to develop. Residents on or near the shore should take action to protect property, and listen to local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for later statements or warnings.
